greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of coefficients of polynomials defined by Binet form: P(n,x) = ((x+d)^n + (x-d)^n)/2, where d=sqrt(x+4).
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
mathematica: P[n_, x_]:= P[n, x]= ((x+Sqrt[x+4])^n + (x-Sqrt[x+4])^n)/2; Table[CoefficientList[Series[P[n, x], {x, 0, n}], x]//Reverse, {n,0,12}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 08 2020 *)
xref: For fixed k, the sequences P(n,k), for n=1,2,3,4,5, are A084057, A084059, A146963, A081342, A081343, respectively.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Jul 05 2009
